sub_topic: Applying the Fourier transform to image processing
message_1: A 2D image has a size of 256 x 256 pixels. Apply the Fourier transform to the image and calculate the total number of complex values obtained in the frequency domain.
message_2:
When you apply the Fourier transform to a 2D image, you obtain a 2D array of complex values in the frequency domain. The size of this array will be the same as the size of the original image, which is 256 x 256 pixels.

So, the total number of complex values obtained in the frequency domain will be:

256 x 256 = 65,536 complex values
